attrs.script:
#!/usr/bin/env bash

sudo yum -y update

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -ex

echo "__ Install httpd and php..."
sudo yum install -y httpd
sudo yum install -y php php-gd php-mbstring php-pdo php-mysqlnd

echo "<IfModule mod_dir.c>
        DirectoryIndex index.php index.html
</IfModule>" | sudo tee /etc/httpd/conf.modules.d/dir.conf

echo "<?php
phpinfo();
?>" | sudo tee /var/www/html/index.php

sudo systemctl enable httpd

# temporarily disable SELinux to prevent httpd to MySQL authentication issues
# this is for testing only and should not be done in production environments
echo "__ Temporarily disable SELinux..."
sudo setenforce 0

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -ex

sudo rm -rf /var/www/html/* || true
sudo yum erase -y httpd php || true

#!/usr/bin/env bash

sudo yum -y update

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -ex

echo "__ HAProxy installation..."
sudo yum install -y haproxy &&
  sudo systemctl enable haproxy || true # idempotent
haproxy -v

echo "__ HAProxy configuration..."
# http://cbonte.github.io/haproxy-dconv/1.8/configuration.html#4
port=80

echo "global
  log 127.0.0.1 local0
  log 127.0.0.1 local1 notice
  maxconn 4096
  quiet
  user haproxy
  group haproxy
defaults
  log global
  mode http
  retries 3
  timeout client 50s
  timeout connect 5s
  timeout server 50s
  option dontlognull
  option httplog
  option redispatch
  balance  roundrobin
# Set up application listeners here.
listen stats
  bind *:8080
  mode http
  log global
  stats enable
  stats hide-version
  stats refresh 30s
  stats show-node
  stats uri /stats
#listen admin
#  bind 127.0.0.1:22002
#  mode http
#  stats uri /
frontend http
  bind *:${port}
  maxconn 2000
  default_backend servers-http
backend servers-http" | sudo tee /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg

sudo sed -i 's/server host-/#server host-/g' /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg

hosts=$(echo "@@{WebServer.address}@@" | sed 's/^,//' | sed 's/,$//' | tr "," "\n")
for host in $hosts; do
  echo  "  server host-${host} ${host}:${port} weight 1 maxconn 100 check" | sudo tee -a /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
done

#!/usr/bin/env bash

sudo yum -y erase haproxy

#!/usr/bin/env bash

sudo yum -y update

#!/usr/bin/env bash

echo "Generic uninstall script, goodbye!"

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -ex

echo "__ HAProxy installation..."
sudo yum install -y haproxy &&
  sudo systemctl enable haproxy || true # idempotent
haproxy -v

echo "__ HAProxy configuration..."
# http://cbonte.github.io/haproxy-dconv/1.8/configuration.html#4
port=80

echo "global
  log 127.0.0.1 local0

  maxconn 4096
  quiet
  user haproxy
  group haproxy
defaults
  log global
  mode http
  retries 3
  timeout client 50s
  timeout connect 5s

  option dontlognull
  option httplog

  balance  roundrobin
# Set up application listeners here.
listen stats
  bind *:8080
  mode http
  log global
  stats enable
  stats hide-version
  stats refresh 30s
  stats show-node
  stats uri /stats
#listen admin
#  bind 127.0.0.1:22002
#  mode http
#  stats uri /
frontend http
  bind *:${port}
  maxconn 2000
  default_backend servers-http
backend servers-http" | sudo tee /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg

sudo sed -i 's/server host-/#server host-/g' /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg

hosts=$(echo "@@{WebServer.address}@@" | sed 's/^,//' | sed 's/,$//' | tr "," "\n")
for host in $hosts; do
  echo  "  server host-${host} ${host}:${port} weight 1 maxconn 100 check" | sudo tee -a /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
done

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -ex

echo "__ HAProxy installation..."
sudo yum install -y haproxy &&
  sudo systemctl enable haproxy || true # idempotent
haproxy -v

echo "__ HAProxy configuration..."
# http://cbonte.github.io/haproxy-dconv/1.8/configuration.html#4
port=80

echo "global
  log 127.0.0.1 local0
  log 127.0.0.1 local1 notice
  maxconn 4096
  quiet
  user haproxy
  group haproxy
defaults
  log global
  mode http
  retries 3
  timeout client 50s
  timeout connect 5s
  timeout server 50s
  option dontlognull
  option httplog
  option redispatch
  balance  roundrobin
# Set up application listeners here.
listen stats
  bind *:8080
  mode http
  log global
  stats enable
  stats hide-version
  stats refresh 30s
  stats show-node
  stats uri /stats
#listen admin
#  bind 127.0.0.1:22002
#  mode http
#  stats uri /
frontend http
  bind *:${port}
  maxconn 2000
  default_backend servers-http
backend servers-http" | sudo tee /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg

sudo sed -i 's/server host-/#server host-/g' /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg

hosts=$(echo "@@{WebServer.address}@@" | sed 's/^,//' | sed 's/,$//' | tr "," "\n")
for host in $hosts; do
  echo  "  server host-${host} ${host}:${port} weight 1 maxconn 100 check" | sudo tee -a /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
done

#!/usr/bin/env bash

sudo systemctl stop httpd

#!/usr/bin/env bash

sudo systemctl restart httpd

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -ex

# Assuming CentOS/RedHat 8.2
# https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/linux-installation-yum-repo.html

# sudo yum install -y "http://repo.mysql.com/mysql80-community-release-el8.rpm" &&
#   sudo yum module -y disable mysql &&
#   sudo yum install -y mysql-community-server

# database must be started for SQL configuration
sudo systemctl start mysqld
# database should start on OS boot
# sudo systemctl enable mysqld
# sudo systemctl status mysqld.service
echo "__ Connect to MySQL database with root"
mysql --user=root --password='@@{MYSQL_PASSWORD}@@' <<- "EOF"

# echo "__ Test_Webapp_Read_Write_Sql"
CREATE DATABASE IF NOT EXISTS webapp ;
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS webapp.tecc_dba_test ( \
  id INT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT , \
  time DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP , \
  comment VARCHAR(80) NULL DEFAULT NULL , \
  PRIMARY KEY (id)) \
  ENGINE = InnoDB CHARSET=ascii COLLATE ascii_general_ci COMMENT = 'testing';

FLUSH PRIVILEGES;
CREATE USER 'tecc_webuser'@'%' IDENTIFIED WITH mysql_native_password BY 'end-user-provided-password' \
  REQUIRE NONE WITH MAX_QUERIES_PER_HOUR 0 MAX_CONNECTIONS_PER_HOUR 0 MAX_UPDATES_PER_HOUR 0 MAX_USER_CONNECTIONS 0;
GRANT SELECT, INSERT ON *.* TO 'tecc_webuser'@'%';

CREATE USER 'tecc_webuser'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED WITH mysql_native_password BY 'end-user-provided-password' \
  REQUIRE NONE WITH MAX_QUERIES_PER_HOUR 0 MAX_CONNECTIONS_PER_HOUR 0 MAX_UPDATES_PER_HOUR 0 MAX_USER_CONNECTIONS 0;
GRANT SELECT, INSERT ON *.* TO 'tecc_webuser'@'localhost';

FLUSH PRIVILEGES;
EOF

#!/usr/bin/env bash
set -ex

# Assuming CentOS/RedHat 8.2
# https://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/8.0/en/linux-installation-yum-repo.html

# sudo yum install -y "http://repo.mysql.com/mysql80-community-release-el8.rpm" &&
#   sudo yum module -y disable mysql &&
#   sudo yum install -y mysql-community-server

# database must be started for SQL configuration
sudo systemctl start mysqld
# database should start on OS boot
# sudo systemctl enable mysqld
# sudo systemctl status mysqld.service
echo "__ Connect to MySQL database with root"
mysql --user=root --password='@@{MYSQL_PASSWORD}@@' <<- "EOF"

# echo "__ Test_Webapp_Read_Write_Sql"
CREATE DATABASE IF NOT EXISTS webapp ;
CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS webapp.tecc_dba_test ( \
  id INT NOT NULL AUTO_INCREMENT , \
  time DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP , \
  comment VARCHAR(80) NULL DEFAULT NULL , \
  PRIMARY KEY (id)) \
  ENGINE = InnoDB CHARSET=ascii COLLATE ascii_general_ci COMMENT = 'testing';

FLUSH PRIVILEGES;
CREATE USER 'tecc_webuser'@'%' IDENTIFIED WITH mysql_native_password BY 'end-user-provided-password' \
  REQUIRE NONE WITH MAX_QUERIES_PER_HOUR 0 MAX_CONNECTIONS_PER_HOUR 0 MAX_UPDATES_PER_HOUR 0 MAX_USER_CONNECTIONS 0;
GRANT SELECT, INSERT ON *.* TO 'tecc_webuser'@'%';

CREATE USER 'tecc_webuser'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED WITH mysql_native_password BY 'end-user-provided-password' \
  REQUIRE NONE WITH MAX_QUERIES_PER_HOUR 0 MAX_CONNECTIONS_PER_HOUR 0 MAX_UPDATES_PER_HOUR 0 MAX_USER_CONNECTIONS 0;
GRANT SELECT, INSERT ON *.* TO 'tecc_webuser'@'localhost';

FLUSH PRIVILEGES;
EOF
